description: This portrait of Fernande Olivier—one of Picasso's models and lovers—translates the basic features of her distinctive face into the faceted and fragmented geometric language of Cubism. It was sold in 1912 to the photographer and dealer Alfred Stieglitz, who loaned it to the New York presentation of the Armory Show, a groundbreaking exhibition that presented European avant-garde art to American audiences for the first time.
title: Head of a Woman (Fernande)
